atmosphere.name: Atmosphere
atmosphere.desc: A Realtime Client Server Framework for the JVM, supporting WebSockets and Cross-Browser Fallbacks Support

cassandra.name: Cassandra
cassandra.desc: A partitioned row store; it is a fault-tolerant alternative to NoSQL, with an emphasis on performance and scalability

CraftBukkit.name: CraftBukkit
CraftBukkit.desc: An implementation of the Bukkit server API; Bukkit is a free, open-source, software project that provides the means to extend the popular Minecraft videogame multiplayer server

elasticsearch.name: Elasticsearch
elasticsearch.desc: A Distributed RESTful Search Engine, built on top of Lucene

Essentials.name: Essentials
Essentials.desc: A server mod for the Minecraft videogame; a plugin for Bukkit

guava.name: Guava
guava.desc: The Guava project contains several of Google's core \Java libraries: collections, caching, primitives support, concurrency libraries, common annotations, string processing, I/O, and so forth

guice.name: Guice
guice.desc: A lightweight dependency injection framework for \Java 5, by Google

hadoop-common.name: Hadoop Common
hadoop-common.desc: The Apache Hadoop project develops open-source software for reliable, scalable, distributed computing; Hadoop Common is the collection of the common utilities that support the other Hadoop modules

hbase.name: HBase
hbase.desc: A scalable, distributed database that supports structured data storage for large tables for Apache Hadoop

hibernate-orm.name: Hibernate ORM
hibernate-orm.desc: An Object Relation Mapping (ORM) framework for \Java

jclouds.name: jclouds
jclouds.desc: An open source multi-cloud toolkit for the \Java for creating applications that are portable across clouds

junit.name: JUnit
junit.desc: The de-facto framekwork for writing and running unit tests in \Java

k-9.name: K-9 Mail
k-9.desc: An advanced email client for Android

mongo-java-driver.name: MongoDB Java Driver
mongo-java-driver.desc: A \Java driver for MongoDB, which is an open-source NoSQL database

netty.name: Netty
netty.desc: An asynchronous event-driven network application framework for rapid development of maintainable high performance protocol servers \& clients

OpenRefine.name: OpenRefine
OpenRefine.desc: A free, open source power tool for working with messy data and improving it

org.aspectj.name: AspectJ
org.aspectj.desc: A seamless, aspect-oriented extension to the \Java programming language

RxJava.name: RxJava
RxJava.desc: A library for composing asynchronous and event-based programs using observable sequences for the JVM; an implementation of Rx Observables

spring-framework.name: Spring Framework
spring-framework.desc: The framework provides a comprehensive programming and configuration model for modern \Java-based enterprise applications

Terasology.name: Terasology
Terasology.desc: An open source project for procedural terrain generation and efficient rendering techniques in \Java using the LWJGL

titan.name: Titan
titan.desc: A highly scalable graph database optimized for storing and querying large graphs with billions of vertices and edges distributed across a multi-machine cluster

voldemort.name: Voldemort
voldemort.desc: A distributed key-value storage system; it is an open source clone of Amazon's Dynamo

wildfly.name: WildFly
wildfly.desc: A flexible, lightweight, managed application runtime

zxing.name: ZXing (``zebra crossing'')
zxing.desc: An open-source, multi-format 1D/2D barcode image processing library implemented in \Java

hudson.name: Hudson
hudson.desc: An application that monitors executions of repeated jobs, for continuous integration and monitoring executions of externally-run jobs (later renamed to Jenkins)

rhino.name: Rhino
rhino.desc: An open-source implementation of JavaScript written entirely in Java. It is typically embedded into Java applications to provide scripting to end users

openmrs-core.name: OpenMRS
openmrs-core.desc: A patient-based medical record system focusing on giving providers a free customizable Electronic Medical Record

lombok.name: Lombok
lombok.desc: Reduces boilerplate in \Java by adding 'handlers' that know how to build and compile simple, not-quite-java code

dropwizard.name: Dropwizard
dropwizard.desc: Dropwizard pulls together stable, mature libraries from the \Java ecosystem into a simple, light-weight package

hector.name: Hector
hector.desc: Hector is a high level \Java client for Apache Cassandra

hazelcast.name: Hazelcast
hazelcast.desc: A clustering and highly scalable data distribution platform for \Java

jna.name: JNA (\Java Native Access)
jna.desc: Provides \Java programs easy access to native shared libraries by writing just \Java code

docx4j.name: docx4j
docx4j.desc: A JAXB-based library for creating, editing, and saving OpenXML "packages", including docx, pptx, and xslx

cucumber-jvm.name: Cucumber-JVM
cucumber-jvm.desc: Cucumber is a tool for running automated tests written in plain language. Originally developed for the Ruby programming language, Cucumber-JVM is a pure \Java implementation of Cucumber that supports the most popular programming languages for the JVM
